props.Description: A small quiver of arrows, to be used before bow attacks.
props.Name: Arrows

props.Description: Heavier and less graceful than fletched arrows, bolts have the advantage of sheer killing force on short distances.
props.Name: Bolts

props.Description: Fearsome missiles that nearly ignore target's armor.
props.Name: Heavy Bolts

props.Description: Heavier and less graceful than fletched arrows, bolts have the advantage of sheer killing force on short distances.
props.Name: Bullets

props.Description: Simple but effective, a mace is great for close quarters melees with armored opponents.
props.Name: Mace

props.Description: Not everyone can swing this one-handed well, but as the dwarves say, there's a hammer for every hand, and a nail for every hammer.
props.Name: Battle Hammer

props.Description: A maul is a fearsome weapon in strong hands, and cruel besides. Bones with break!
props.Name: Maul
Heavy Flail
props.Flavor: Designed for devastating heavy armored ranks and shieldwalls, this weapon requires good judgment for use or a lot of sheer strength. Preferrably both.

props.Description: An unnecessarily heavy weapon, it might be worth its weight if you have the strength to swing it. Deep breaths!
props.Name: War Hammer

props.Description: Deceptively light, a metal club with a spike can inflict grievous wounds on limbs and head in more ways than a swordsman can think of.
props.Name: Club

props.Description: Not the first choice for a serious fighter, a malus can still hurt a great deal, and not only nails.
props.Name: Malus

props.Passives: AddProp(Std bools, Spectrum Light);ParamBonus(Light Emission, 25+2*{this_c_durability});Damage on Attack(5+{this_c_durability},Fire);Illumination Spectrum(25+2*{this_c_durability});
props.Description: Provides light where none is at hand. A passable weapon against vermin and path-blocking obstacles made of wood. Careful though - the less durability left, the less illumination granted!
props.Name: Torch

props.Description: Provides Essence regeneration based on remaining Durability.
props.Name: Orb

props.Description: Reduces Action Points cost for spells and allows using Wand Missile ranged attack.
props.Name: Wand

props.Description: Provides Essence costs reduction based on remaining Durability.
props.Name: Sphere

props.Description: Reduces Action Points cost for spells and allows using Wand Missile ranged attack.
props.Name: Magic Stick

props.Description: magical item passive traits?
props.Name: Force

props.Description: Often used for ceremonies and rituals, dagger is often referred to as the warlock's last resort.
props.Name: Dagger

props.Description: The single most common sword design in the West, relatively cheap and just good enough to be deadly in a strong man's hand.
props.Name: Long Sword

props.Description: Weapon of choice among assassins, stiletto is a versatile and stylish weapon that is solid enough for real combat.
props.Name: Stiletto

props.Description: A less than reliable weapon, it is small enough however to inflict potentially critical hits into enemy's weak spots.
props.Name: Knife

props.Description: Weapon of choice amongst thugs, this blade is short enough to conceal yet solid enough to cleave armor.
props.Name: Falchion

props.Description: Curved and flowing, a scimitar is most favored by pirates for its crookedness.
props.Name: Scimitar

props.Description: Though thin and fragile, rapier can be most deadly in the hands of an expert swordsman.
props.Name: Rapier

props.Description: A paradoxical weapon of Shai'Kar warriors that is as long as a greatsword yet as light as a scimitar, it is greatly favored by Blade Masters throughout the world.
props.Name: Katana

props.Description: Cross-hilted and longer version of a Great Sword that is favored by human knights for its ability to cleave through multiple unarmored enemies in a wide arc. Most popular among the knights of the Silver Orders but also everywhere in the West.
props.Weapon_Attacks: Twohanded Sword Swing;Twohanded Sword Thrust;Hilt Smash;Sword-Tip Poke
props.Name: Claymore

props.Description: A well-proportioned blade that is good for anyone and perfect for no one. Weapon of choice among squires and fencing apprentices. Economic reasons often make it the default weapon in large military units.
props.Name: Short Sword

props.Description: An apparently unwiedly weapon that turns into a blur of destruction in a Sharadrim's hands.
props.Name: Double Sword

props.Description: A more combat-oriented version of dagger that is good to have down your shin if your sword's been knocked off your grip.
props.Name: Dirk

props.Description: An exotic ritual blade from the East that seems can cut as well as stab. Wounds inflicted with a kris seem to be wider, their blood harvest richer.
props.Name: Kris

props.Description: Weapon of choice amongst pirates, this blade is short enough to conceal yet solid enough to cleave armor.
props.Name: Cleaver

props.Description: Flame Sword is a relatively novel design, allegedly conceived by dwarves of the Red Blaze clan. Its thrusts are usually lethal as the cuts are almost twice as wide as from an ordinary blade.
props.Weapon_Attacks: Twohanded Sword Swing;Twohanded Sword Thrust;Hilt Smash;Sword-Tip Poke
props.Name: Flamberg

props.Description: Illadrim, the ritual blade of Dark Elf origins is all the more deadly for being unlike any other blade. While it resembles a scimitar, it apparently can be used also as a scythe, dagger or longsword. The glory of the Old WorldASCII_OPEN8217ASCII_CLOSEs craftsmanship!
props.Name: Illadrim

props.Description: pure damage
props.Name: Psychic Force

props.Description: 50% slower
props.Name: Spike Wheel

props.Description: 35% slower
props.Name: Impaler

props.Description: Quick and nimble, a hand axe is most loved for its throwing qualities and the element of surprise. Besides, it's one of the cheapest instruments of death, used since the age of the Old Gods. Back to the roots, hack away!
props.Name: Hand Axe

props.Description: Favored by dwarves for its balance and optimal size, the battle axe is your best friend when it comes to a bloody close quarters melee. Chopping it!
props.Name: Battle Axe

props.Description: Simple and savage, this weapon could well be called a lumber axe... yet one would not be wise to underestimate it.
props.Name: War Axe

props.Description: Heaviest and deadliest, the Great Axe immediately demands your enemy's respect.
props.Name: Great Axe

props.Description: Though somewhat cumbersome, in skilled hands a halbert combines great reach and lethal force. Leveraging its length can give it an even greater force of impact - so it might be a good idea to keep a bit of distance between yourself and your foe!
props.Name: Halbert

props.Description: Highly versatile weapon, a pollaxe is not an easy weapon to craft and balance, but well worth the effort - for then a good man-at-arms can make it sings a song of glorious slaughter.
props.Name: Pollaxe

props.Description: Quick and nimble, a hand axe is most loved for its throwing qualities and the element of surprise. Besides, it's one of the cheapest instruments of death, used since the age of the Old Gods. Back to the roots, hack away!
props.Name: Dwarven Axe

props.Description: A relic from the nigh-forgotten War of Annihilation, this axe had once served a demon lordASCII_OPEN8217ASCII_CLOSEs fury. Even aged now, it is a fearsome weapon of heavy-handed slaughter. It appears to have some sinister link with its wielderASCII_OPEN8217ASCII_CLOSEs own rage...
props.Name: Carnifex

props.Description: Cheap and deadly, the spear has been at the tip of mass warfare for as long as it existed.
props.Name: Spear

props.Description: Some might say this is just a walking stick, but there's metal on it, so it belongs in the weapons shop.
props.Name: Staff

props.Description: The wielder of a battle staff can strike foes on left and right without the need to turn their in their direction. Still, it's really just a stick with metal weights on each end, plus Zen.
props.Name: Battle Staff

props.Description: When a scythe enters the battlefield, something has gone terribly wrong in the kingdom.
props.Name: Scythe

props.Description: Penetrates some of enemy's armor and deals more damage with Counter Attacks.
props.Name: Pike
props.Flavor: Penetrates some of enemy's armor and deals more damage with Counter Attacks.

props.Description: Longer and more elaborate than a spear, a lance is favored by mounted knights and those unfortunate footmen who need to fight them.
props.Name: Lance

props.Description: This one is for cutting off feet from under your foes, if you find yourself facing them with no other weapon somehow.
props.Name: Sickle

props.Description: Cheap and deadly, the spear has been at the tip of mass warfare for as long as it existed.
props.Name: Battle Spear

props.Description: When a scythe enters the battlefield, something has gone terribly wrong in the kingdom.
props.Name: Reaper Scythe

props.Description: Cheap and deadly, the spear has been at the tip of mass warfare for as long as it existed.
props.Name: Glaive
